Setup: 
- Stand with your feet hip-width apart, toes pointed forward, and the barbell positioned over the middle of your feet. The barbell should be close to your shins. 
Gripping the Barbell: 
- Bend at the hips and knees to lower your body and grip the barbell with both hands using an overhand grip. 
- Your hands should be shoulder-width apart, and your arms should be fully extended.

Starting Position: 
- With a straight back, shoulders pulled back, and chest up, brace your core and engage your lats. Avoid rounding your back or arching excessively. 
Lifting the Barbell: 
- Push through your heels and drive your hips forward to lift the barbell off the ground. Keep the barbell close to your body throughout the movement.

Hip Extension: 
- As you stand up with the barbell, extend your hips and knees simultaneously. Focus on driving your hips forward and squeezing your glutes at the top of the movement. 
Lockout: 
- Once you're in the fully upright position, stand tall and straight with your shoulders pulled back.
